summary: The Countering Chinese Espionage Reporting Act (S.1778) mandates the Attorney General to submit an annual report, for seven years, detailing the Department of Justice's activities to counter national security threats and espionage by the Chinese Communist Party. This report must cover DOJ operations, dedicated resources, and measures to protect civil liberties. The report will be submitted to the Senate and House Judiciary Committees and published online, potentially including a classified annex. The Attorney General is required to collaborate with several other agencies in preparing the report.
